title: Source Toolbar doesn't behave properly on OBS start

labels.name: Confirmed
labels.description: This bug report has been confirmed by project members

body:
<!-- READ THIS FIRST -->

<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->

## Platform
<!-- Please fill out the following information about your bug report. -->
<!-- If you are on Linux and installed using a package, please list the package type. -->
Operating system and version: Windows 10 2004
OBS Studio version: 26.0.2-91-g3e7e99e0 (https://github.com/obsproject/obs-studio/commit/3e7e99e0f33454200d4f951f1d6672459e05c793)

## Expected Behavior
<!--- Tell us what should happen -->
When the program starts, the source toolbar should show the text "No source selected", as I have no source selected.

## Current Behavior
<!--- Tell us what happens instead of the expected behavior. -->
<!--- Please include a log file here if possible. -->
On program start the source toolbar shows:
![Pic](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39059951/98935151-64aa7180-24e3-11eb-950e-da6edab7197a.png)
It is also possible to click on "Properties" and "Filters" in this state.
Once I click on a source, and unselect it again, the toolbar works correctly and shows me the text "No source selected".

## Steps to Reproduce
<!--- Provide a link to a live example, or an unambiguous set of steps to -->
<!--- reproduce this bug. Include code to reproduce, if relevant. -->
<!--- Screenshots and video are encouraged if applicable. -->
1. Start OBS
